taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Found in rice fields, small ponds and pools in hill streams (Ref. 4832).  Collected from streams with fast flowing, clear water, over a substrate with rocks, sand and pebbles (Ref. 36341).  Most specimens obtained in late March 1997 appeared to be sexually mature (Ref. 36341).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  known only from the Myitnge watershed of the Irrawaddy in northern Shan States, Myanmar (Ref. 36341).  Questionable in Thailand (Ref. 1632) and in the Salween basin (Ref. 12041).
dataObjects.references: Fang, F. 2000 Barred Danio species from the Irrawaddy River drainage (Teleostei, Cyprinidae). Ichthyol. Res. 47(1):13-26. (Ref. 36341)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal soft rays (total): 10; Analsoft rays: 13 - 15; Vertebrae: 33 - 35

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Talwar, P.K. and A.G. Jhingran 1991 Inland fishes of India and adjacent countries. vol 1. A.A. Balkema, Rotterdam. 541 p. (Ref. 4832)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Incomplete or complete lateral line; infraorbital process absent; branched dorsal fin rays 7; usually 10 or 11 branched anal fin rays.  A distinct series of narrow vertical bars anteriorly on side of body, followed by a horizontal P stripe extending to end of caudal peduncle; barbels absent or rudimentary (Ref. 36341).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Conservation
dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment

dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Vishwanath, W. 2010. Devario shanensis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
DD
Data Deficient

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Vishwanath, W.

Reviewer/s
Daniel, B.A., Rema Devi, K.R., Arunachalam, M. & Dahanukar, N.

Contributor/s

Justification

This species has been recorded from two drainages by later workers, so it could be a more widely distributed species although this required confirmation. The impact of harvests for the aquarium trade also required further information. For this reason it is considered as Data Deficient.
